description: The televised scenes of triumphant Iraqi troops appeared to confirm reports that Islamic State militants had been driven from the Baiji refinery in northern Iraq.
title: Iraqi Troops Seen Inside Besieged Oil Refinery
title_page: Iraqi Troops Seen Inside Besieged Oil Refinery - The New York Times
maintext:
Regaining control of the refinery is the government’s most significant victory since June in its fight to roll back the extremists, who retain control of much of the northwest of the country.
The refinery at Baiji is Iraq’s largest, and government forces have struggled for at least six months to break the siege. The government first announced that it had done so in June and most recently reiterated that announcement over the weekend. But the images on state television were the first confirmation that the refinery had been retaken.
